title: Number of snow sports ( skier/snowboard ) visits in the United States 2000 to 2019
yAxis: Number of skier visits in millions
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Number of skier visits in millions, with a total of 19 data points. The chart has 8 significant trends.
The longest trend is slightly negative which exists from 16/17 to 12/13.
Differently, the next significant trend is extremely negative which exists from 18/19 to 16/17.
Contrarily, the next significant trend is slightly negative which exists from 12/13 to 10/11.
On the contrary, the next significant trend is extremely positive which exists from 10/11 to 08/09.
Similarly, the next significant trend is moderately positive which exists from 08/09 to 06/07.
In a similar manner, the next significant trend is slightly positive which exists from 06/07 to 04/05.
Similarly, the next significant trend is moderately negative which exists from 04/05 to 02/03.
But, the next significant trend is moderately positive which exists from 02/03 to 00/01.
gold: This graph depicts the estimated number of skier and snowboard visits in the U.S. during the winter seasons between 2000 and 2019 . During the 2018/2019 season , the U.S. had about 59 million snow sports visits in total .
